headline.main: NBA's Atlanta Hawks to Be Sold to Businessman Ressler
headline.print_headline: NBA's Atlanta Hawks to Be Sold to Businessman Ressler

docs.snippet: The NBA's Atlanta Hawks are set to be sold to a group led by businessman Tony Ressler, the team announced on Wednesday, in a deal precipitated by the release last year of a racially charged email by the team's current owner....
docs.lead_paragraph: The NBA's Atlanta Hawks are set to be sold to a group led by businessman Tony Ressler, the team announced on Wednesday, in a deal precipitated by the release last year of a racially charged email by the team's current owner.

headline.main: Senate Panel Rejects Tough Currency Rules for Fast Track
headline.print_headline: Senate Panel Rejects Tough Currency Rules for Fast Track

docs.snippet: A U.S. Senate panel on Wednesday rejected a push to beef up rules against currency manipulation in a key trade bill, avoiding a clash with the Obama administration and U.S. trade partners....
docs.lead_paragraph: A U.S. Senate panel on Wednesday rejected a push to beef up rules against currency manipulation in a key trade bill, avoiding a clash with the Obama administration and U.S. trade partners.

headline.main: Review: 'Age of Ultron' Is an Avengers Overdose
headline.print_headline: Review: 'Age of Ultron' Is an Avengers Overdose

docs.snippet: It will surely stand as one of the most peculiar and possibly ironic entries in a director's filmography that in between Joss Whedon's two "Avengers" films there reads "Much Ado About Nothing": a low-budget, black-and-white Shakespeare adaption sa...
docs.lead_paragraph: It will surely stand as one of the most peculiar and possibly ironic entries in a director's filmography that in between Joss Whedon's two "Avengers" films there reads "Much Ado About Nothing": a low-budget, black-and-white Shakespeare adaption sandwiched between two of the most gargantuan blockbusters ever made.

headline.main: ZTE Cleared of Infringing InterDigital Mobile Phone Patent
headline.print_headline: ZTE Cleared of Infringing InterDigital Mobile Phone Patent

docs.snippet: A U.S. jury on Wednesday cleared Chinese telecom equipment maker ZTE Corp of infringing a patent on transmitting data in wireless networks owned by patent licensor InterDigital Inc....
docs.lead_paragraph: A U.S. jury on Wednesday cleared Chinese telecom equipment maker ZTE Corp of infringing a patent on transmitting data in wireless networks owned by patent licensor InterDigital Inc.

headline.main: First Look: Pixar's 'Inside Out' Leaves Audience in Tears
headline.print_headline: First Look: Pixar's 'Inside Out' Leaves Audience in Tears

docs.snippet: There wasn't a dry eye in the over 4,000-seat Colosseum theater as the credits rolled following the first screening of Pixar's "Inside Out" at CinemaCon on Wednesday morning....
docs.lead_paragraph: There wasn't a dry eye in the over 4,000-seat Colosseum theater as the credits rolled following the first screening of Pixar's "Inside Out" at CinemaCon on Wednesday morning.

headline.main: Advocate: Sheriff Video Release Is 'Character Assassination'
headline.print_headline: Advocate: Sheriff Video Release Is 'Character Assassination'

docs.snippet: Video released by investigators that shows an undercover sheriff's deputy allegedly buying drugs from a man later killed by a volunteer officer amounts to "character assassination," a civil rights advocate said Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Video released by investigators that shows an undercover sheriff's deputy allegedly buying drugs from a man later killed by a volunteer officer amounts to "character assassination," a civil rights advocate said Wednesday.

headline.main: EU leaders prepare response to migrant crisis
headline.sub: EU leaders prepare response to migrant crisis

docs.snippet: EU leaders are set for an emergency summit on the migrant crisis, where they're expected to discuss possible military missions to capture and destroy traffickers' boats. Mana Rabiee reports....
docs.lead_paragraph: EU leaders are set for an emergency summit on the migrant crisis, where they're expected to discuss possible military missions to capture and destroy traffickers' boats. Mana Rabiee reports.

headline.main: U.S Bailout of AIG in 2008 Was 'Punitive,' Ex-CEO's Lawyer Says
headline.print_headline: U.S Bailout of AIG in 2008 Was 'Punitive,' Ex-CEO's Lawyer Says

docs.snippet: The U.S. government was "punitive" in its bailout of American International Group Inc in 2008, a lawyer for the company's former chief executive argued during closing arguments of a trial that may impact how much flexibility regulators will have w...
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. government was "punitive" in its bailout of American International Group Inc in 2008, a lawyer for the company's former chief executive argued during closing arguments of a trial that may impact how much flexibility regulators will have when they respond to future financial crises.
